Authentication attempts using credential.Data: Windows Event ID 4624; Windows Event ID 4625; Zeek conn.log; Zeek http.log
Authentication attempts using credential.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4624 and 4625 for authentication attempts using usernames known to have potentially exposed credentials in public repositories. Analyze Zeek conn.log and http.log for connections originating from unusual external IPs followed by authentication attempts. Use frequency analysis and time series analysis to identify anomalous bursts or consistent patterns of authentication failures/successes for specific accounts compared to established baselines.

Inbound network traffic or endpoint acti.Data: Zeek conn.log; Zeek http.log; Zeek smtp.log; Windows Event ID 4688
Inbound network traffic or endpoint acti.Action: Analyze Zeek smtp.log for inbound emails targeting specific employees whose names or roles were potentially exposed. Examine Zeek http.log and conn.log for connections to suspicious domains or IPs from internal hosts, potentially initiated via phishing links. Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for suspicious process creation activities on endpoints, correlated with indicators from Zeek logs (e.g., process launched after opening a document from a suspicious email). Use correlation analysis to link events across different log sources.

Numerous failed attempts to access inter.Data: Windows Event ID 4625; Zeek dns.log; Zeek conn.log
Numerous failed attempts to access inter.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4625 for failed login attempts targeting usernames potentially identified from public code repositories. Analyze Zeek dns.log for lookup requests for internal hostnames or services that are not commonly accessed externally, potentially using names discovered in repos. Analyze Zeek conn.log for connection attempts to internal IPs/ports that should not be exposed, potentially based on architecture details found in repos. Use frequency analysis on failed attempts/lookups from external sources and correlate events to identify patterns of enumeration.

Network connections or authentication at.Data: Zeek conn.log; Zeek http.log; Windows Event ID 4624; Windows Event ID 4625
Network connections or authentication at.Action: Analyze Zeek http.log for unusual HTTP requests targeting internal API endpoints, particularly those including API keys or specific credential patterns in headers, URLs, or body. Correlate with Zeek conn.log to identify source IPs. Monitor Windows Event ID 4624 and 4625 on servers hosting internal services for authentication attempts using hardcoded or unusual credentials that match patterns potentially found in repositories. Use statistical analysis (e.g., identifying rare combinations of source IP/API key/service or anomalous request rates) to spot suspicious usage of internal services.
